meanings.definition: To divert or distract from the main topic or focus.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, he kept sidetracking the discussion with irrelevant stories.
meanings.sent2: She tends to sidetrack when she gets excited about a new idea.
meanings.sent3: The cat sidetracked the dog by chasing its tail around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden laughter sidetracked my train of thought like a playful puppy.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights outside the window were sidetracking me from studying for my exam.

meanings.definition: To cause someone or something to deviate from a planned course of action.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected rainstorm sidetracked our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The construction noise sidetracked the workers from completing the building on time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel sidetracked the delivery person by stealing their keys.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter sidetracked me from my serious mood.
meanings.sent5: The colorful distractions in the room were sidetracking the students from focusing on their assignment.
